title: SENIOR FEMALE SINGLES GROUP SEEKS NEW MEMBERS 65+
text:
The older we get, the more difficult it becomes to make new friends. So a number of years ago a few of us decided to start a women's group for straight, single, active, senior women to get together for lunch once a month as well as other activities. Our membership is limited to 12 members and now we find a need to replace one of them. We want to keep our group small and friendly. We're a group of senior women who have found this to be a great way to make new female friends. It's a community based group with most members living in the northwestern suburbs ~~ Robbinsdale, Crystal, New Hope, Brooklyn Center, Brooklyn Park, Maple Grove, Plymouth and Golden Valley. But if you live outside this area and don't mind driving a distance to join us, you're more than welcome!

Some of our members created a 4-some that meets twice a month to play 500. Two other members found they had an interest in common ~~ going antiquing and to estate sales, so they enjoy this together. Two other members enjoy the casino, so they've become casino buddies. If you have a special interest, a member of our group may have it as well. These women were strangers before they joined our group. Now they've made new friends.

There is no membership fee. Your only expense is whatever the cost is for your lunch or event. Our next activity is lunch at a restaurant in Maple Grove in April. Usually about 5 or 6 members attend ~~ small, informal and friendly.

If you're uncomfortable meeting a group of people that you don't know, I'll be happy to meet you for coffee at a public location so at least you'll have met one person. This is an opportunity to expand your circle of friends. Just respond to this ad with the subject line of Gals All Together and I'll get back to you with additional information about our group.


(This ad will be removed once the opening for the new member has been filled.)

title: FEEL ALONE TOO OFTEN...
text:
I remember life before marriage. Before children. I remember longing for one another constantly. Just holding one another all night and nothing else in the world seemed to matter. I remember loving one another with every ounce of our being. I remember lusting for one another (at minimum) daily. I remember staring in her eyes on our first date and knowing, without a doubt, I was staring into the futute. I remember passion. 
And then the first child came. And then the rings went on our fingers. And then life began. A life filled with love for one another and our children. A life we we had both dreamed of. A life we worked so hard to attain. A life filled with frustration. A life filled with exhaustion. A life devoid of sex. A life without the expression of that passion we once shared. 
I love my wife with all of my heart. I love my children with every ounce of my being. I look in their eyes and know, without a doubt, I see the future. I see graduations, and weddings, and grandchildren. I see a life worth living. A life worth being proud of. But I miss sex. I miss (the occasional) moments of irresponsibility with minimal consequences. I miss lust. I miss the passion.
I have no idea why I posted. I have no idea what my intentions or motives are. Maybe this resonates with you? Maybe you'd like to chat? I'm never opposed to making a new friend, and I love to learn about other people and hear their stories. I guess if you'd like to chat, drop me a note. I hope you're having an awesome night!

title: I'll keep this simple...
text:
I just completed divorce proceedings last spring. Not quite a year ago. (Maybe throwing our the baggage right away will help save some people some time :) ) My friends and family have been asking if I'm looking to meet someone new or when that would be and I just figured I'd know when the time was right. And to be honest, I miss having someone tell me how funny I am lol

Seriously though, there is just something special about women. Im financially secure and have enough of my ducks in a row, but I miss the thrill of secret kisses, of seeing a new text, of finding out what makes her world beautiful and figuring out new ways to become a part of that. So, as it turns out, I want to meet someone. Someone who can LITERALLY Netflix and chill at first and can understand my wanting to look before I leap. Sexuality will definitely be a part of my future, but I want it to be after I have some trust and context. Call me boring. Sex is way better when you get to know what makes them wild and when they want just as badly to bring you there with them.

Me: white, early 30's, reasonably fit, short brown hair (full head still!), blue eyes, dimples.

You? Probably under 40, race is open, body shape is open... Just be funny, smart, reasonably self aware... Gotta be able to take a joke and have a comically thick skin. Im one who 'goes there' with all manner of iff color humor. So be warned.

Lets just spend some time with the newness of it all and see if we both end up preferring eachother :)

title: Advice
text:
I have a question for the ladies here. I recently started talking to a woman from OKC. We chatted for about a week, flirted, laugh and good chats. We decided to meet last Sat to go bowling. We met and she smiled and I smiled. She was cute. We bowled a couple of games, laughed, had a good time even shared a few "touches" through out the night. So before the night ended I asked her if she had a good time and if she would like to go out again. She said yes. I offered to make her dinner and she seemed to love the idea. So at the end of the night I walked her to her car and reached to give her a hug and she leaned in to kiss me. I reciprocated with a "nice" kiss goodnight.

I asked that she shoot me a text when she got home (we had a couple of drinks) she told me she would. When she got back to me I told her thanks' for the nice night, that I had a good time and looked forward to Tuesday. I guess I also told her I thought she was Sexy. She said she had a great time and thought I was cute also. On Sunday we did not talk, I sent her a message yesterday just saying " Hope you are having a good day". She sent me a message stating that she was sick and had pink eye in both eye's. I was wondering if I should be taking that as a hint that she did not want to meet again. I asked her about it and she told me that she had fun, thought I was cute but did not feel any connection.

So I guess the question here is mostly for the single ladies. What are your expectations when you go out on a date? Do you have to have that immediate connection? What makes you want a second date. I guess I ask myself two questions. One did I have fun, and secondly did I think she was cute? If the answer to those two questions is yes I ask for a second date. I guess I just think putting all the pressure on one date to have a connection it really doesn't give anything a chance. Especially if you enjoyed yourself. Connections take time to grow.

So I am sure you can guess that I kinda liked this girl. We had fun, some great chat's online and on the phone, seemed to have several things in common.. I guess I'm just confused. I don't understand women. lol

title: Good Lord! Who has time for this ...
text:
Seriously. There are hundreds of postings on here, all saying the same thing.

"MWM, doesn't want to change things at home" ... No kidding!

"Looking for a friend, a discreet one" ... because a normal friend is too blabby LOL!

"Huge married cock needs a ride" ... Cripes! His cock is married, but he's not?

"Are you compasionate and sensitive?" - Spell check please!

And I didn't don't even go near the Casual Encounters for fear of catching a disease or two.
Can that even happen?

But ... where do we turn? We can't hit on our hot married neighbor next door. We can't really let our friends know about this and have them hook us up. Bars! Well, so here we are right? Married. Unfulfilled. On Craigslist with the rest dregs of society and a few normal ones like us. Right?

I'm not stuck on myself, I promise. I'm just particular I guess. This is dangerous territory that we're treading through ... I want to make sure it's with the right person. Quality over quantity.

So, if you're married too and you just haven't found what you want, give me a shout ... you never know.

Please be attractive, in shape ... age/race doesn't matter ... and fun to chat with. I do want to get to know you before we go further.

title: Needs some Insight
text:
Hi Craigslist,

I need some help. 

My wife and I are recovering from a major relationship issue from the past when she decided to have sexual relations with other men. I want to say I'm over it, but deep down inside, I feel like I'm really not. We're in a good spot today, but I know there's still some things she's not telling me because she KNOWS it'll hurt me if she shares that information. I supposedly already know a lot she tells me, like 80-90%. This secret though, the final 10-20%, it pains me, and she tells me some things are better left unknown. I want to believe her, I want to trust her, but what she's asking for is a HUGE ask I feel.

I just don't know if i will ever truly get over it if I don't get the 100%. I feel like it'll loom over my shoulders forever otherwise, but I only time will tell?

My question is, should I really just let it go? If so, how the hell do I even do that? After her most recent share about what she's done (late last night), I've been having nasty images of her and another man on replay in my head all day and it just makes my heart drop. Am I in the wrong to be feeling this way? Is what I'm feeling justified? I mean, she's here with me now, she did choose to stay with me, but why do I still feel this way? There's just so much going on I'm not sure what to think of it. I love my wife and I think she's beautiful, but I'm think I'm reaching a threshold I didn't know was there before?

Anyway, if you've read this far already, please provide some insight to your thoughts about my perception of my relationship. I really need some help and can't carry this alone. If you're wondering, I've shared how I've felt with my wife, but she dismisses my points and can't empathize with me. She's closed that chapter in her life and has moved on, I want to do the same, but for me, it's so much harder and I can't understand why. I'm beginning to think I'm experiencing some PTSD or something.

So if you've been in a similar situation or have a deeper understanding of the greater issue at play, your response will be very much appreciated. Thanks you Craiglist.

title: Twenty Not So Platonic Questions
text:
I'm working at home today. Bored stiff. I also had a fun date over the weekend, so I'm feeling just a little revved up and flirty. 

So I thought I'd throw out a game of "Twenty Questions" for anyone that's also bored and, er, "flirty". 

I'll start with the first three. Why blow through everything at once, right?

1. The last person you slept with (or are currently sleeping with) - how long after you first met him did you sleep together? 

2. What's the riskiest and most inappropriate place you've ever gotten busy? 

3. What is something that guys *think* is hot, but really, really isn't?

It's Monday, partly-cloudy, nice outside, and the Twins are in spring training. I'm not a 'bot, in other words. 

Hey, it's just a time-killer...

title: Ground Rules
text:
I am seeking platonic Female friends. I am not looking for ANYTHING else. I'm also not interested in an on-line ONLY relationship. If that's what you want, you can stop reading.

I do not text, nor do I like talking on the phone for more than a minute or two. I usually make arrangements to meet someone, or see if they are around, so I can stop by, but that's it. If these too are not for you, then stop reading.

I'm very picky about whom I spend time with. Many behaviors and things people do, are not things that I condone, or tolerate. I don't care if you do some of those things, but I will not hang out with you if you do them while I am around.

I will not answer ANY questions via email, so don't bother asking. I want active, real world friends. If you meet me, you can ask me then. Also, please use complete sentences when you email me. Otherwise, I will have NO IDEA what you are talking about, and will tire of it very quickly.

title: Для вас, где бы
text:
Для вас, где бы вы ни находились.

Несмотря на то, что мы друг от друга и никогда не встречались, те веры говорят, что в этом мире пространства и времени, мы уже вместе, но просто не могу видеть его еще. Таким образом, чтобы облегчить боль неумолимое время, я пишу это письмо в надежде, что это как-то оформить вашу душу к моим.

Правда быть известно, я искал тебя и до сих пор во всем мире. На улицах, в моих мечтах ... и в глазах каждой души я встречаюсь.

Я потратил на этот раз отдельно от вас в одиночку, устанавливая цели, реализации мечты и стать человеком, которого я всегда хотел быть. У меня было много поездок в течение моей жизни, те, которые я буду делиться с вами. Когда-нибудь я буду также узнать о том, что вы пережили в своем собственном пути, ища меня тоже.

Там было много, кто спросил меня, кто вы и что вы стоите. Мой ответ на них всегда было то же самое, что женщина, которую я люблю знает свою ценность и любит меня больше. Она имеет глубину в ее сердце больше, чем бесконечность.

Они говорят, что лучший успех, что один приходит после того, как их самых больших разочарований. Так что здесь я не буду, не привыкать к разочарованиям жизни или очень глубокие шрамы любви, но все-таки я готов сделать путешествие, чтобы найти свою любовь и простое счастье.

Самое замечательное из всех вещей в жизни, я считаю, это открытие другого человека, с которым наши отношения имеет реальную глубину, красоту и радость как годы растет. Любовь между двумя людьми является наиболее чудесная вещь. Своего рода Божественной аварии.

Можно сказать, что я нахожусь здесь, ожидая, чтобы найти. Для того, чтобы увидеть, может ли я найти ваше сердце. Я хочу, чтобы кто-то говорить и кого-то, чтобы слушать. Я хочу, чтобы домашняя жизнь больше, чем трудовой жизни. Я хочу, чтобы комфорт рутины и острые ощущения от неожиданного. Я хочу, чтобы страсть, доверие, верность и прощение за ошибки. Я неудержим в одиночку, но вы совершите меня, и вместе мы сможем достичь невообразимых высот.

Это время в моей жизни, когда все прощено и все будет отрабатывать. Я потерял, но в большей степени я был благословлен, все, что делает меня, кто я сегодня.

Мысль о том, в одиночку пугает больше всего. Мы пытаемся найти тот, который мы привлечь к на внешний вид, когда мы должны показывать наши сердца, а также - но вы будете видеть меня, и вы найдете меня. Я буду стоять перед вами с открытым сердцем, который вы будете заполнить больше с счастья, мира и любви.

Так что пока мы не встретимся, знают, что я здесь ... терпеливо ждет

GJO

title: Need Venting - Please Read and Reply?
text:
Hi Craigslist,

I need some serious help for I am having internal battles about my current relationship.

My wife and I are recovering from a major relationship issue from the past when she decided to have sexual relations with other men. I want to say I'm over it, but deep down inside, I feel like I'm really not. I feel like we're in a good spot today, but I know there's still some things she's not telling me because she KNOWS it'll hurt me if she shares that information. I supposedly already know a lot she tells me, like 80-90%. This secret though, this area of unknown, the final 10-20%, it pains me sooooo much though, and she tells me some things are better left unknown. I want to believe her, I want to trust her, I want to give her my 100% but what she's asking for is a HUGE ask I feel and I don't know if I can do it. 

I just don't know if i will ever truly get over it if I don't get her 100% of the story, if I don't hear it straight from her, I feel like I will have reservations for her no matter how hard I try to love her again. I feel like it'll loom over my shoulders forever otherwise, but I only time will tell?

My question is, I guess, should I really just let it go? If so, how the hell do I even do that? Or, how do I make her tell me the full story? Maybe it's truly better if I don't know, because maybe it'll truly crush me? At this point though, I don't really care and just want to know!

After her most recent share about what she's done in the past which was a couple nights ago, I've been having nasty images of her and another man on replay in my head all day and it just makes my heart drop. Am I in the wrong to be feeling this way? Is what I'm feeling justified? I mean, she's here with me now, she did choose to stay with me, but why do I still feel this way? I still feel like something is still missing and I don't quite understand what it is. There's just so much going on I'm not sure what to think of it. I love my wife and I think she's beautiful, but I think I may be reaching a threshold I previously wasn't aware of?

Anyway, if you've read this far already, please provide some insight to your thoughts about my perception of my relationship. I really need some help and can't carry this alone. Lugging these thoughts around all day to-and-fro work, home, and everywhere else has been extremely taxing. 

If you're wondering, I've shared how I've felt with my wife, but she dismisses my points and can't empathize with me. She's closed that chapter in her life and has moved on, I want to do the same, but for me, it's so much harder and I can't understand why. She feels just in her decision-making then and doesn't feel remorseful for how she made me feel and hates the thought of apologizing or even feeling the slightest bit empathetic. I guess for her, she says, she was all ready to leave when she performed all those acts, therefore, her heart was elsewhere, and therefore her body too. I'm like, FML....

Anyway, that's enough. I can write a novel if I wanted to. 

So if you've been in a similar situation or have a deeper understanding of the greater issue at play, your response will be very much appreciated. 

Thanks you Craiglist.

title: I'm Delusional
text:
I keep thinking that I can make new friends using the internet, and more specifically craigslist. That's why I am delusional. I may be insane too, because to do the same thing over and over, while getting the same result, and thinking that the result will be different, is one definition if insanity.

I'm not too picky. I'm not unlikeable. I'm not dangerous. I'm not an imbecile. I''m just different from the rest. Too different apparently.

I just wanted people to do things with, that was all.

Being delusional, I'll probably try again in the future, when the anguish of this recent series of attempts wears off. I have hope, and that's eternal. Even craigslist can't crush THAT.

title: Be electric with me.....w4poet/writer
text:
You love fitting words together, shaping them into images. So do I. 

Between us, we could weld grand thunderstorms of longing, hear the screech of bending iron, feel the friction of thought paired with thought. We could spit words out at one another like marbles, send them rolling through blood vessels, through heart valves, through cranial nerves, through windpipes that sigh in the dead of night while the sweating moon looks in the window. 

We may play. We may fuck or be tender or hate each other's guts. Indeed, we may never meet, but we'll pack sentences together like careful origami and send them to one another through the magic of internet. Let's make our hearts pound through an imperfect love of an imperfect language. Let's suspend disbelief. We'll make words the currency of our own reality and leave the rest of the world behind. 

Write to me. Let's see what happens.

title: Thanks For Lettin' Me Bend Your Ear Flo
text:
This post is just for a lark really. Think what you like about it, or not.

I think everyone is crazy. If you look closely, dig deep, watch long enough, you could pick out some THING that makes you feel some type of way. If you WERE... fully conformist?... I'd be SHOCKED. I certainly hope you aren't, 'cause I'm not. I want to hear about your non-conformity. NO... REALLY.

Unfortunately, I'm not like anyone else that I can find. I can't seem to get the peg in the hole. (not innuendo) That's a subject I want to keep away from. With you anyway. (platonic section)

The goal was new friends. That's what this functions as, right? Maybe I have it all wrong and this is just some version of a chat room. People just looking to yackity-yak (don't talk back) via text, and nothing more, 'cause it seems that way, just sayin'.

I thought, and still think, that it's a community board to post offers and offerings, for others to come to a central location and peruse through, to acquire aforementioned things. Am I wrong?

Since I haven't been conveying a proper message, in the correct way, to appeal to someone who'd like a companion for mutually enjoyable things, I'll put out, since it's a fairly simple thing to request, that you take a walk with me. It can be short, long, or really long. It's up to you. If you want you can ask me a shitload of questions before we walk anywhere. Like a speed date. You should make a card with them on it, for brevity. There are few I won't answer, and Some will certainly be replied to with some of my own.

The point is to meet and talk, so if you want questions answered, you can ask my face. Want to see it, send yours first. I don't care, but everyone else seems to, and since I'm attempting to be that way for the sake of compromise, I'll reciprocate. My post, you go first. Don't get bent out of shape if I'm not flash with the picture. I can't stand that anger and dismissal thing. Settle down, take a minute, and BREATHE!

I've got one hand in my pocket, and the other one is waving a good bye.

title: HPV Inquiry w4w
text:

I've given blow jobs since then, but having gone from multiple lovers to none it's been rather difficult for me :-b.

So, was wondering if someone reading this has HPV as well and could answer some questions into how you handled it. Thankfully I have the non-cancerous strain, so that's awesome. The only 'cure' is time. It'll be really hard, but it can be as little as 6 months for it to go away, but as much as a year and my doctor doesn't seem to think it's a big deal. Just wondering if you just cut out sex in your life? Or did you continue, just making sure condoms were used? Just curious what changes you've done? I know it seems weird to post, but I am afraid I will give in to my urges, especially if after six months it's not gone as I go crazy usually after a couple weeks.

title: Spinning thoughts, want your fair share?
text:
You are sitting alone tonight, wishing for something, but you are not sure what. 

And your thoughts are spinning quietly, as they always do, round and round and round inside your head... and you feel alone. 

You have been with others, many others, but have never really felt "not alone" for long. And...your thoughts have never stopped spinning, while the thoughts of others never really seemed to spin in the same way as yours... not for long anyway. 

You have also been with only a few others that you have shared this with... You know, that you have told about your thoughts that have never stopped spinning for long, and how they don't seem to spin like the thoughts of most others do.

But those few others, well, at first, seemed to understand what you were sharing with them, you know, before much time had passed. Maybe before enough time had passed to make their understanding real.

And of those very few others... unfortunately, there were not many that for long, really wanted to hear your thoughts. You know... the thoughts that have never really stopped spinning for long.

And at that point...because it never feels very good to stop them from spinning, you eventually walk away... to let them spin, to let them spin in the way that they need to spin to make you feel alive again.

Over and over and over...this has happened. Has happened to me, anyway. 

Then one day, I realized, that in some way, my spinning thoughts actually make me feel ok, maybe even happy, whether I feel alone or not. 

So now, I just let them spin... I don't stop them, and don't hide them, and never stop sharing them, and never stop being happy, not for long anyway...well, perhaps simply not for as long. There are moments...laugh. 

And I now try to let all others do what they need to do as well, you know, to be happy. So as they do what makes them happy, I don't seem to worry about them, or about myself either. Not as much as I used to, anyway. In any case, most things seems to work out, over time, over some time. 

There is a reason you are reading CL. You want to find someone that you can feel ok sharing with, and let them feel ok sharing with you... 

With this in mind, perhaps you should just ramble on and on and on (like I just did...) and simply not worry about being graded, judged, or changed? Just a thought, my thought at the moment... 

I guess that is what I am trying to do by writing tonight. As I let my thoughts spin, spin, spin,...simply just share a few... without much worry. 

I mean, really, what's there to lose? And, perhaps, what's there to gain? That may be a good question...smile.

title: Hey Ladies!
text:
Hey ladies! I didn't think I'd find myself resorting to Craigslist to find friends, but here I am! I'm 25, single, and childless (by my own choice, I swear). I drink and am 420 friendly, you don't have to be but don't judge me for it. I love animals and am very compassionate about them, I'm a vegetarian, in the process of going vegan. I love to try new activities and go to new places. In my own opinion, I'm hilarious, and I absolutely love to laugh, so a sense of humor is a must! I like to go out on the weekends, but I'm also not opposed to staying in and watching Netflix or gettin down on some classic super nintendo. With summer coming up, I can't wait to get outside and enjoy nature. I could go on for awhile, but I won't. 

If you think we'd hit it off, please send me an email with your favorite movie as the subject so I know you're real (bonus points if Fantastic Mr Fox is your favorite movie). If you have Facebook, send me your link and I will add you, if you'd like. I'm looking to chat briefly and then meet up either for coffee or at a park or anywhere else public. title: Teddy Bear Dad Seeks Friendship. . .
text:
I am the proud father of a 3 and ½ year old girl. I have been separated from my wife since September, the divorce has went from ugly to civil to nasty. It was to be settled in early April, but due to the fact that issues are unresolved it wasn't finalized. Aside from being in a divorce and custody fight I have a lot of other things going on as well. I am not in legal trouble, nor am I into drugs (which makes me ddf) or anything illegal. I'm very upfront about things, I know some will be intimidated by my situation, but those who aren't will find a teddy-bear of a guy(big, harry and loveable!)
I'm financially embarrassed, which means I don't have money (I'm self-sufficient and not looking for someone to take care of me!) I'm creative when it comes to doing things, even with little or no money. I'm adventurous and like to experience new things. I'm looking for friends, if anything develops out of that I'm more than ok with it. I have lots of time on my hands, I don't currently work due to a spine condition. I'm still mobile, yet I have days where I move slowly. I enjoy things like music (country, older rock, pop, etc. . .), movies (especially comedies as I like to laugh), fishing, sports (Twins, Vikings. . .), other outdoor activities. . . I also like to go to Theatres, concerts, dinners, and other activities where I dress up.
I'm a person who will be honest and open. I believe in communication, it's what cost me a marriage and in my opinion one of the biggest sources conflicts in any relationship. I also will bend over backwards for a friend. I am seeking someone who doesn't mind that I will on occasion blow up their phone when I need a friend, and know that they can do the same. I also believe in apologizing when I do make a mistake and appreciate being told when I make one. I sometimes need to think about what I did, but I will always apologize. I am looking for someone who understands that if we get mad, laugh, hug, cry, etc. . .everything is going to be fine with us and we can still be friends and be there for one another!
If this sounds interesting to you, I would love to hear from you. I prefer texting to start, as I don't have internet and use Wi-Fi when I email. I live in Hinckley and would prefer someone that lives in the area or can come to the area as I can't afford to drive.
Thanks,

Teddy Bear Dad

title: Drive-in Movie Invite - Now Open - Showing...
text:
NOTE: This is a PLATONIC invitation - I am only seeking a friend to share an evening at the movies.

Want to go tonight 4/10? Now showing: Superman vs Batman, Deadpool, and 10 Cloverfield Lane.
- all are unseen by me and of interest... Might still be there next weekend...

I am looking to meet a nice gal to accompany me to the Drive-In movies, as a friend now...
- and please, a remote chance of a future long-term friend or more...

You:
While I am not seeking a literal 'date' - I would prefer if you were also in the market for a LTR (I am) as the possibility of this evening progressing towards friendship and further dates would be very nice.
Would you agree - an evening is always funner if you are with someone you enjoy being with... 

So I ask only a few things = Please be:
- between 20 and 50 
(if you are under 40, I would be glad to go only as friends, yet still request matching all)
- any height
- healthy please - Skinny, Average or A few extra. (within 30 lb of HWP)
- clean and D/D free. 
- not a BBW please. 
- not a person who uses 420 or any form of drugs!
As I mentioned, my hope is to develop a friendship which may progress to more in time. 
Besides, if we are healthy and clean - we can both be comfortable sharing popcorn... 

I'm the one doing the driving and hosting, so all I ask is to please be a woman who at least I can enjoy feeling comfortable around and enjoy talking with... and I am not comfortable with one who does not match the characteristics above...

I would hope to swap photos and type some first... maybe even swap cell #s and talk some - I do want you to feel safe and enjoy the evening so it is important you are OK before we go. The point of the evening is to share the movies with a friend - nothing more. 

Who knows, we may get to like each other... or just become incredible friends... right?!
That is it - I have NO expectations beyond enjoying the movies and the company of a friend.
And yes - this is a rewrite of a 2012 post, so I have posted this on and off for 4 years, and have gone a few times and had a nice time. One became a friend and we typed for years till she married some guy.

Me:
I am a 56 yo, 6'5", white, nearly average, D/D and and coffee free. My other interests are bicycling, walks, hiking, travel - weekend road-trips or other, canoeing/kayaking, just being active and enjoying the outdoors - before the next snowfall... then a new list... :)
(I do not drink coffee - my vice is Diet Mountain Dew! after all, have to be awake for the drive home)...

Why the drive-in?
3 movies for $8.50... And I spring for the gas to get there (around $5-$6). 
When it gets warmer, we can sit outside if the mosquito's aren't bad - yet for now - my car has some comfy luxurious leather seats with a nice center console to hold the drinks... We can get some dinner from Subway or take-out of your choice en-route, and spend the evening watching 2 or 3 movies and having someone to talk and laugh with! 

About timing and parking: We have to get there early as the theater will have cars waiting all the way to the high-way waiting to pack all the decent up-front spots by 7 pm (7:30 Sundays). We should plan on getting there by 6:45 pm (or 7:15 Sundays) to get in line for the front good spots (Best spots are 1/2 way between the screen and concession stand in the shadowed area of the photo).
Getting there early is beneficial anyways - besides a great spot for a better view of the movie, we will have plenty of time to talk, eat dinner and get to know each other before the show.

So - WHY am I writing this invitation? Besides the fact it is embarrassing to go to the drive-in alone... and I have. It is so much more fun sharing the evening with a friend. Someone to talk to during intermission, laugh at the funny parts, and yes - maybe get a bit teary at serious moments, of course, depends on the movie. And yes - I do not talk as much as I type... 

So - email me, lets type a bit, maybe chat, and get ready to go to Vali-Hi some weekend or weekday evening soon - maybe even tonight! 
We can even meet any time/day before - if you want to before we go... 
Thanks for reading and Have a Great Day/night - Look forward to email/chatting with you...

T

P.S. DO NOT Send SPAM or solicitations for dating or sex - or any link to ANY Adult site - I WILL NOT sign up under any circumstances 'to see your pictures or phone #, or verify my Id with CC# for any reason !!!' I will report all replies soliciting anything to sending email servers and recipient sites which will result in loss of affiliate referral profits.

title: Black Man for Woman to Discuss Sex & Life. (real convos, no meet-ups)

I would especially love to hear from you if you have a very active sex life whether people know about it or even better do not know about it and its a side-thing. Also big plus if you are into poly or non-monogamy.

There is a real chance we are NEVER going to meet and this might all be via Email. I could be open to coffees during the day to share and discuss. I could be open to other things as well.

I am not into body-shaming. I respect people of all different ages, shapes, sizes, and shapes. Diversity makes the world beautiful!

title: What are you searching for?
text:
Perhaps you are like me. You wonder how you got here. You never imagined yourself searching Craigslist for a posting that might connect with what is missing in your life. You are an intelligent person and have opportunities, but getting involved with friends and coworkers would be a mistake, so you play it safe.
You are looking to scratch that itch which you feel in quiet moments and all too often you feel yourself writing off even though you desire it strongly. I have come to figure that these moments are the quiet desperation that Thoreau wrote of and part of me is still not willing to go peacefully and accept this in life.
So here I am. 
I am a good natured, outgoing person whom is confident with who I am and how I appear. I am creative and have many activities that keep me busy and I will try anything once. I don't have any vices that are too harmful with the exception of searching Craigslist for what is missing in my life or marriage. I tend to think that even though I am
happy with what I have , I still keep pushing myself to develop as a person, and yet still find myself wanting of the passions that are not in my everyday life. Upon deeper reflection, i believe I tend to yearn more for the opportunity to let out these thoughts than try to fulfill them- meaning a friend or confidant with which to share and get feedback from, and in return would do the same.
I dream of the opportunity of a woman that would sit down next to me and strike up a conversation which would grow into an undefined and deep personal connection for us. We would share ideas, laughs, coffee and whatever the other one needs with no pressure or judgement. This would not be a relationship of expectations or dependency, but one that supports the other. It would be a safe place in which we would be able to be that person aloud that we don't usually show the world. 

What traits am I looking for?
Nothing too complicted; 
Strong character
Good sense of humor
Intelligent

title: Looking for someone who wants to learn skills together?
text:

title: Difficult to control
text:
Hello,

So maybe this is just a bit of a rant, but I'm also a little curious who's out there. See, I have this problem. On a scale of 1-10 it's like a 13. I used to be very social, too social maybe, and of course only with women. Despite several efforts, I've just never been close to any men. I guess maybe it's because women are cuter and I can flirt with them. And you know that feeling you get when you think someone is just a little bit interested in you? Like they hang off everything you say, even when you're just being yourself?

Anyway, then I got married and due to several events, dropped literally every person in my life outside of family so that my marriage wouldn't fall apart. I totally understand it's not good to be close to another woman when you are married. However, it's been 3 years now and I'm really having a hard time with it. Maybe it wouldn't be so bad if I had just someone to talk to, but I don't. I work from home and am with my wife literally 24/7. I love her to death, but sometimes she just drives me crazy too.

So, yeah, like I said, I'm venting. Probably not many who care, or should care. Sometimes I'm glad I don't talk to anyone, I've always been a bit of a loner. But sometimes...like now, I long for it. So much so that my whole body craves for it like an earthquake, tearing every cell and throwing it to pieces. Nothing wrong with casual emails right? No...it's not true, because if she knew, she would be devastated. So yeah, maybe you understand, and maybe you respect marriage, which you should. Just let me vent, it feels good to just tell someone, even if I have no idea who you are.

title: One of the few - alone by choice.
text:
Are you simply tired of trying to exchange with the average person? 
Are you wired in a way that you have never actually felt as though you fit in...for long anyway? 
Have you never stopped looking for a path that would bring you to thoughts, situations, and opportunities that you didn't already know about?

Are you tired of being alone, mentally, not long after most relationships begin? 
Do you think you will never actually not feel alone because of the way you think, the way you simply can't turn it off for long? 

Have you gotten to the point where there now seems to be more comfort in simply spending most of your time alone? 
Have you done this for a while now, but still...

Can't stop wondering? 
Can't stop thinking that you are surely not alone in the way that you are wired? 
Can't stop asking where there are others like you? 
No, not the same, but those that have thoughts that simply won't stop occuring either? 

Questions that won't stop being asked, but hold little interest to others it seems? 
(No interest, unless you become famous, of course!) 

If you would like to try exchanging in this direction, try from your direction.

Really, what have you got to lose? I can't see you, I can't hear you, I can't make you stay around. I can be blocked and deleted.

So... 

Start with words of thought. 
Any words that hold value to YOU! 

Start with a drawing.
Any type of drawing that you have created or enjoy staring upon.

Start with something you have written or read.
Something that holds value to you, whether you understand it or not.

Start with questions.
Questions you have lived with, that you know have no definite answers.
Questions you have about what I have shared. I may not answer. I don't have to answer anything!

Start by sharing a peek at the fire that keeps your head ablaze.
You know, the fire you have often attempted to put out.

Not because it actually ever hurt you.
But because others told you to.
Or made you feel weird when they saw it.

I won't ever tell you to put it out.
Because I never tell myself to put mine out either.

Want to show me that those like you don't exist, by not responding? Do it if it holds value for you. 
Will that hold value for you?
Give it some thought, it may or may not...smile.

title: Seeking Undate-able Woman With Super Powers
text:
I could not be any less like the creature that most of you seek. 

Your desires outlined with so many words about soul mates, perfect families, dream jobs, and a vast network of close friends. Just normal, normal, normal.

I find it funny (or not so funny?), that two drinks and fifteen minutes (or an hour and a cup of coffee) usually reveals worlds full of addiction, hyper-sexual (therefore non-sensual) acting out, artists that love being artists but hate art, groupies that like bands but not music, victims (survivors) of bad decisions, bad health, bad relationships, and bad luck. 

Anything poetic seems to be stopped, anything significant seems to cease, and the ennui of day to day and skin to skin seems to creep in. So you hate your job, everyone does, or they wouldn't call it a job would they? Everyone hates someone in their family, familiarity breeds contempt. Yes, when you get drunk you sleep with people you don't know and are likely to get diseases, so don't get so drunk. Sorry, there is no "bad" art at the Walker, Weisman, or MIA, because "bad" art doesn't mean anything. How can you not hate your Ex who tried to destroy you? And no, at your age you don't need silicone boobs... 

We all have our story, it's just the deception that turns me off. 

To be very upfront, I am undate-able at the moment..(or so says my best friend.) 

Therefore, I am seeking a similarly undate-able woman of extraordinary (well, I'm not extraordinary, but...) ability to write and perhaps spend time with (really maybe, maybe, maybe some day eventually) until the world decides we are date-able again. 

If you are intellectually out of this world (intellectual base, that is), emotionally and psychologically out of your mind from time to time, and promise not to write "what was that about?" when I send slightly poetic but nonsensical emails, please respond.

title: Genuine, Attractive, Successful... and empty
text:
I don't get how I'm here right now. Alone, unloved, empty. I've just tried to follow all the rules and do the right thing. I know a weeping man is very unattractive to women, so I don't expect any female responses (I'm sure I'll get all kinds of sympathy from gay men... don't worry no one has to know right?). I guess I'm writing this post because I have nothing else to do. I've written posts and profiles on dating sites before, but nothing like this. This is more of a rant -- a cry for help -- than it is an advertisement. I'm well aware many of the things I'm writing here are a 'no-no' if I seriously wanted to catch somebody's romantic interest. 

I've poured my heart both into others and into myself. I am drained emotionally because of it and have no-one there to support me, which I desparetly need. 

By most measures, I 'have it all' -- good looks (atheltic body and handsome), successful job (6 figures), and caring/loving personality... and yet after three decades, I can't make a meaningful connection with a real attractive female. I'm not talking about sex, and my standards are high (as they should be) but not ridiculous. For example, everyday I run out of 'likes' on Tinder (meaning I'm swiping right a bunch). It's crazy so many women I get matched up with won't even talk to me -- what's the point of a match? It seems the only ones who will are actually fake profiles, robots who follow some script which ultimately leads to some website.

Even though I am kind and good hearted, I have an assertive, type A personality. I have always been associated with leadership positions wherever my school/career have taken me. I'm the guy who runs meetings, delegates tasks, as well as 'gets things done' when no one else will. All this to say that I am much much closer to Marty McFly than his father, George.

Because of my giving personality, however, I have been taken advantage of. I have given, given given... and it seems I am always on the same side of giving/receiving. I was involved in a long distance relationship with a woman I never actually met for over five years. It wasn't a catfish but at this point it might as well have been. I thought I had a connection there but in the end it appears there wasn't one. And apparently, from the view of those I interact with daily in person, I don't need any support. I will admit I don't exude any vulnerability so I can see why people aren't prodding to find it. But it is there. And it is crippling me tonight. I just don't know what to do anymore. 

My primary love language is touch. It is killing me inside to have gone this long without ever having a women I can just connect and cuddle with. I just want someone to hold me. To just love me without it being about sex, favors, partying, etc. I just need love... even if it's just for one night, and I am beginning to feel like I'll never have it....

title: Workout Friends
text:
Okay, I realize this request is extremely specific and maybe a little unorthodox, but what the hell, it's Craigslist...right?

The short version: I love working out, I am big into fitness and neither my wife (yes, I said wife) nor my friends share this passion. The adrenaline, the feeling of accomplishment and the excitement that this part of my life brings out needs to be celebrated, it wants to be fueled by someone else with similar goals and experiences. My wife and friends do not understand and frankly don't want to talk about it. I guess I am kind of looking for a BFF (best fitness friend). Someone to help push me, someone I help to push. Share successes, failures and someone to keep each other on track! Maybe we work out together, maybe we just root each other on, maybe someone to say "get out of bed and get your ass to work!!!". I think these feelings and these experiences need to be shared and celebrated and what better than someone experiencing the same thing, maybe needing a little help and just excited about being healthy???

So, why am I looking for a woman you ask? Well, let me say this up front. I am looking for nothing besides a BFF and this is a totally innocent platonic post, however, working out and fitness comes with some excitement and tension I thought I could be exciting to share this with someone that these feelings could simmer a bit. Because this is innocent, I don't care if you are married, single, engaged...whatever. Just looking for someone who shares my passion and maybe looking for a partner to share it with.

I don't need to share pics, but am far from afraid too if you are interested. Let's start with talking about our goals, our routines and maybe try to help each other on where to go. Maybe we email each other just once and we move on with some good ideas, or maybe we text every day helping push each other to the next level and maybe even work out together. Cardio, lifting, intense, laid back, I am open to anything. 

If any of this sounds like something interesting, send me a line and let's chat?

Thanks!!!

title: Sharing Struggles, Troubles, Fears, Goals and Dreams
text:
I am reasonably bright, more kind than not, more fit than not, and passably attractive. I also have a pretty long history of working to deal with depression, as well as anxiety. And kind of flirted with addiction for some years, though completely clean and sober for years now, without going to AA or anything. I just stopped enjoying being wasted, I guess. Regardless, want to throw out that I never did anything worse than pot ... just did that and drinking kind of a lot.

Right! So honestly, not expecting *anyone* to respond to this, at this point! See, here is my problem ... I have a decent job, I've been to college (BA), I have immediate and long-term goals, I am interested in other people and I have a sense of humor ... but, I guess I am/have been dysfunctional in a number of ways, as well, and that does not make for the greatest small talk. Unless, I guess, you are talking with someone who is equally dysfunctional.

I am single, never married, and no kids ... and at this stage in my life, I find it understandable but also pretty sad, that it is easier to find someone to find sex than friendship. That is why this is in the strictly platonic section. It is not that I do not like or want sex at all, but more that I want someone to talk over all our daily troubles and feel a personal connection with, much more.

Some of it is that my job just dominates my life, at this point ... but, I think part of the reason for that is because I don't really have much of a life to compete with work, anyway. I would like to, though!

title: Looking for a bestie
text:
Hello,


I'm 24, female, and almost, kinda, not really married. I've been with my man for almost three years, and he has two boys. I'm a step mom, and didn't really plan on being thrown into this early in my life. I'm still learning.


I don't have many friends that I can hang out with, even though I claim to have many friends. Most of my friends are into clubbing and drinking all the time. I can do that every once in a while, but prefer a good friend on my back porch with a glass of wine or a beer any day. I work full time as the Assistant General Manager of a gas station/restaurant/ whiskey bar, so that keeps me pretty busy. 

I grew up fast so I'm told I am mature for my age. I hold manners and politeness in the highest regards and cannot stand rude or mean people. If you are good at being mean, please don't respond to this ad, we probably wouldn't make good friends. I have a completely open mind on many subjects, and I don't judge people for their decisions. I'm agnostic, but having religious friends would be great. Also, I'm bisexual, but as the almost husband has made clear, he doesn't want to share. So interests beyond friendship are going to be snuffed out quick. 

I love video games (mostly RPGs and table tops) and reading books,?sewing, learning to cook and bake, kids movies or cartoons, trying new wines (mostly Rieslings), going to the gym and being lazy at home, camping, thrift store shopping, attempting arts and crafts, and I love love LOVE coffee. 

I'm really just looking for a friend to hang out with, whether it be in or out. Someone fun and nice, who can have a great time without blowing their paycheck. Maybe if they were with someone we could double date. I just need someone to turn to, that I could call and chat with, or text funny pictures and share horribly corny jokes to keep smiles on both of our faces. 

I'm struggling right now with a serious case of anxiety and depression, but am getting help for it. Some days are just hard. Those are the days I need a friend the most. Even just a friendly text (I'm bad about instigating them) would make my day.? Hopefully new friends would be close. I live in Lakeville right off cedar and 160th.? 


OK? I've probably done enough rambling. I hope you are having a great day!

Please respond to this with email, and have the subject line as your favorite animal (mythical or otherwise ) so I know you are real.

title: Ten questions for you!

Ten Email Challenge

This is probably a bad idea. That's probably why I'm doing it.

I've become kind of obsessed with CL. I regularly check the missed connections after I've gone out hoping someone will have seen me and wanted to know more. It hasn't happened yet, and I don't expect it to happen anything! LOL!

I'm currently obsessed my job, and am so needing a vacation soon! I'm kinda falling for woman who are endearing, nice, and a little older, but I am not picky! You know what they say beggars cannot be picky!!!! I guess that's kinda my thing, although I'm not specific on what I think?

Anyway, here's my challenge: 10 email exchanges between us, anything goes as far as kind of conversation, and after that maybe we meet up. Maybe we just start texting. title: My Mediocrity Knows No Bounds
text:
Most people will tell you how great they are, not me. I'm not great.

I've run into people who tell me that they are "has beens." I'm a never was, and will likely never be. Maybe next time around.

My life consists of the same stuff over and over, like a less interesting, no action, version of Groundhog Day, the movie. I'm comfortable with that, because I've had a lot of uncertainty in my life, and the routine is nice and comfortable.

I'll never try to impress you with who I know, how expensive my stuff is, or how great I am, because I'm comfortable with how I am, and that's all that counts.

Now I've posted a BUNCH of times here, and gotten no real interest, and that's just fine with me. I don't need, or want, awesome people in my life. Who the hell wants that, man. I'd have no idea how to handle that, since I'm so mediocre. It'd probably just confuse, or scare, me.

If you want to hang out and do some not so great things, and talk about boring stuff, send me a long boring reply. I have time to read long inane emails, because I don't do anything... EVER.

Send me a bland, no pose, no smile, no makeup, hair undone, full body picture, so I can be bemused by YOUR mediocrity. Wear something unrevealing and colorless, because that's how we roll.

Thanks,

In jest.

I was aghast since I don't know if I could do this whole ordeal a second time...

I told you I was going golfing in Phoenix but that I was so afraid that I was going get hurt again. You told me to suck it up and bring out the driver and whomp it lol.

I don't have many female friends but you gave me courage and I thank you for taking the time to candidly speak with me. 

I got a personal trainer at lifetime and I'm hitting balls almost everyday. I'm now able to cross train and lightly jog up and down the stairs (no longer one foot at a time!) 

Seriously. Thank you for telling me to "quit being a baby and try to hurt myself since that means I'm trying to get back to living."

I've started living again and I've started to have hope again. 

I hope I see you at the gym again since I do truly thank you for taking me aside and telling me it gets better if I let it.

title: too much cruising and jerking off...update
text:
Lately I've been thinking that I spend way too much time looking for sexual connections and masturbating. There is an excitement to doing this, and I think it can be addictive. Luckily, I can put this aside at work. I really don't think about it much there. I'm not always thinking about it, just too much in my opinion. I think of what a waste this is since it usually leads to nothing. There are so many better things that I could be doing with my time. On one hand, I have to give myself a break; I haven't had many good connections in the last several years. That has lead to a lot of frustration. On the other hand, I probably could be making better choices about meeting men (I like guys). I know that loneliness and shyness play a part in my predicament. However, I try to meet guys in different ways. I'm always keeping my eyes open at work, the gym, grocery store, etc. This hasn't been very successful. I find myself alone most of my free time. I'd really prefer to have a partner than hook up with random guys. I never thought that I'd be single so long. 

I did some research online about edging. Edging seems to have an effect on the brain like drug use. I'm sure it's fairly mild, but the brain can change over time. Jerking off for hours probably isn't the most healthy thing. I don't use drugs at all; I'm not even a drinker, but I edge a lot. Edging is bringing yourself close to orgasm and stopping then repeating. 

Most guys watch porn while they jerk off. I know that there are plenty of porn addicts out there, but porn has never meant much to me. I hardly ever view it. I don't like porn because it is a lot like prostitution. I have to think that some porn stars would rather be doing something else with their lives. I'm sure some guys enjoy that kind of work, but some have to really hate it. If you're watching porn, you probably are watching guys being victimized. That is a big turn off for me. Not to pass any judgment here if porn is your thing. I'm not perfect, of course. 

I decided to try to go without jerking off and cruising for sex (I didn't commit to stopping the cruising all together, but I really wanted to limit it drastically) for two weeks. I've been at this since Monday, and I would say I've done pretty good. I did spend about five minutes doing some online cruising, but I haven't jerked off at all. I have been spending up to several hours a day jerking/cruising, so I think that five minutes in about six days is a huge change. I'm feeling horny now, but nothing too bad. The temptation is there. I'm thinking that I probably won't meet up with anyone, but I didn't commit to that. I just feel that I'd like to know that I can go two weeks without an orgasm. I will forgive myself if I have a wet dream. :) 

Just thought that I'd write this to get my feelings down. Maybe see what type of response I might get from others. I'm definitely not trying to preach here. Anyone got any thoughts to share with me? Anyone out there relate to any of this? 

Have a great weekend, guys!

Update: My original ad was posted February 21, 2015. Things are better...less jerking off and cruising, but I'm feeling depressed. That never stopped me in the past, so I'd call that some progress. I had several responses to the ad, but no real connection for support. This is disappointing. I met one guy and chatted quite a bit, but he just disappeared. Nothing shocking. Unfortunately meeting like-minded people is not very easy. I know that sometimes it may be my fault; it's hard to give people the chance that they deserve. I get frustrated, and I may be quick to judge. Sorry if I offended anyone. I really try to be a good guy, but I know sometimes I fall a bit short of what I'd like.

Update 4-2016: Unfortunately things have not been going so well. Wasted a lot of time cruising, JO, and having guys play games with me. I find myself fantasizing about more "out there" fantasies. I realize that this probably is bad for me. More chances of getting hurt emotionally or physically.

title: And now for something completely different ...
text:
Everybody seems to be looking for "the one."  If you are single,  you want to find Mr. Right.  If you are married you want that amazing affair with someone who understands you so much better than your spouse.

But how is that search working out for you?

It seems that there are many short flings here at CL.  You email intensely and it seems so wonderful ... only to have all fizzle when you actually meet ... or to find out that schedules just don't align.  

How about trying something totally different.  Isn't there a place between the all out love interest and the boring , everyday friend?  Couldn't there be a place where you connect in a deep way but it still allows you to have your other relationships  and go on with life without the all consuming nature of many romantic relationships.  

Maybe we could connect in a special way, but not make it an obsession.  Maybe we could meet periodically for  lunch, a walk at the lakes, a nighttime drink ... but not see it as "the one" relationship that fulfills every desire.

What if we were close ... confidants in a way ... able to share things with each other we don't talk with many others about.  But at the same time we may have other romantic interests, friends, or even "the one."  Life is about more than a single type of  friendship.  

A young woman can benefit from an older man in her life to care about her, support her, encourage her and share experiences.  An older gentleman can benefit from her youthful zeal.  This works because it is not meant to be the primary love interest of either. We are simply special friends sharing a unique and different type of relationship.  

I'm a youthful, insightful, caring gentleman that is very handsome for my 50 years.  I'm successful and highly intelligent with a wealth of life experience.  

Since attraction is a vital part of any relationship you need to be intelligent, insightful, able to carry a meaningful conversation and very physically fit.  Not a super model per se, but someone that is noticed when you enter a room.  You have no problem getting dates, but that is not what you are looking for here.  This is simply a special form of friendship where you can share in a way you don't with your husband or significant other.  

You are here at CL searching these posts ... something is missing in your life ... something is not working in the way that you are currently doing relationships.  Maybe this is the out of the box friendship that you need to set you on a different path.

title: A note to affectionate guys
text:
Some of us guys just need more affection than others. I think about touching and being touched a lot; usually several times a day. These fantasies are usually platonic; I can separate affection and sex needs. For some reason, I seem to need affection from men more than women. Maybe this is because of my same-sex attraction, but I don't know.

My parents almost never touched me when I was a kid. I didn't have affectionate friends either. When I was about 14, a boy in my class put his hand on my shoulder as he passed by me and said, "hello". It was an amazing experience for me. I had just discovered that I enjoy touch. I really hadn't even known what I was missing until then. I'm not sure how common my experience is.

I have done some research about touch, but there isn't much out there. I learned that children who aren't shown affection tend to either need a lot of it as adults, or they become adverse to it. The lack of touch can be very damaging to infants. Americans in general are somewhat affectionate, but there are places where showing affection is more common. Does anyone know of some good research?

I find day to day life really lacking when it comes to touch. I wish that people were more open to showing and receiving affection. I have to be careful with who I touch because some men are really uncomfortable with being touched. I take notice when a guy brushes against me. I have to wonder if he craves touch too. I will admit to subtly touching a guy like that many times. When I ride the bus, or I'm at a movie I wonder if I will be next to a guy that will let his leg touch mine. This is very stressful. If I allow my leg to touch his, will he quickly pull away? Will I make him uncomfortable, or will he appreciate the contact too? I'm sure that some guys hardly notice the touch; they neither like nor dislike it. If the guy seems to like the touch, I will move my leg up and down very slightly once or twice. If he does the same, it is great! If this causes him to pull away, I feel guilty for invading his space.

I studied massage therapy and worked in the field for a while. This became draining for me; I gave touch, but I rarely got any back. Not that I was expecting to be touched, I just didn't know that it would be so difficult to give and not get any touch back. It reminded me of how much I wanted to receive touch.

After I've interacted with a man several times (like at work, for example), sometimes I put my hand on his shoulder for moment. I hope that he will reciprocate later, but usually he doesn't. I never want to be pushy because I know that some guys are really uncomfortable with being touched.

I was with a guy from work last night at my place. We had good conversation, not just the usual superficial type. I felt a little lonely though because we had no physical contact. For me, good conversation with no physical contact can be lonely. I asked him if he was okay with hugging each other. He thought it was odd that I asked, but he was fine with it, and he gave me a nice hug. I think it's interesting that we have worked together for two years or so, and he never touched me until last night. We probably shook hands when we first met, but that was about it. When I was a teenager working my first job, several guys were very affectionate with me. As time goes on, it is harder and harder to find men like this.

People are very affectionate with pets; it seems that a lot of people would rather get affection needs met with a pet. I'm sure that many dogs get much more affection than I do! This is sad. Pets really do little for me. We had dogs when I was younger, but I never felt really close to them.

Sometimes I go for weeks with little affection. This really wears on me. I deal with depression, and I know that some touch would help. Affection is a great stress reliever too.

I was hoping to find some men that relate and share some thoughts with me. I'm very comfortable with meeting if there is a good connection. I hate texting, and emailing isn't much better. I'm good with talking on the phone at first, but I prefer meeting in person.

I'm a very nice guy, sensitive, down-to-earth, respectful, intelligent, very honest and introverted. I like meeting all kinds of nice people. Making new friends would be nice. I especially like real friends that don't mind helping each other (even working) when needed. However, I don't have a specific agenda. If you just want to talk about something, I'm open to that too. There doesn't have to be any physical attraction between us for us to be platonic friends, and I'm not going to refuse to meet someone just because I feel no physical attraction. If this is important to you, say so up front. Otherwise we may spend time together only for both of us to be frustrated later. I hug people that I'm not physically attracted, but it would be difficult to cuddle with someone that I wasn't physically attracted to. So, if you care, I'm 6-2, bearded, brown/gray hair, leaner than average, young-looking for my age, and handsome (your opinion may vary). I'm mostly attracted to guys around my age or younger. Again, it's more about the person inside than what's on the outside.

Keywords describing me, likes, etc: trustworthy, caring, fitness, floral design, atheist, respectful, long walks, deep conversation, hugs, personal growth, volunteerism, gardening, quietness, reflection, and lots more.

When responding, please include a pic and something about yourself. Also, let me know what you want. I will share a recent pic too. Also, change the subject line in the email. Yahoo emails end up getting grouped together by subject, and it can get very confusing.

One more thing. There are men on here that post ads, and they clearly aren't interested in platonic friends. Please help to clean these ads out. Open the ad and click on the "prohibited" link at the top. If several people do this, the ad is removed. 

Thanks. I hope to hear from you!

Me:

I'm active, white, non smoker, very light drinker, NO drugs, semi-retired, intelligent, hard working, honest, financially secure, independent, trim and fit. I'm a widow looking for a male companion to hang out with a few times a week. I want to stay active but I'm terrible at making social plans. Here are some of the things I wouldn't mind doing:

I enjoy gardening and have lots of perennials. I love hostas.
I can bowl but I don't have a ball and the last time I was in a league was in high school. I do have bowling shoes.
Somewhat to get away in the winter with. Maybe a couple of weeks or a couple of months.

You:

Late 50's to early 60's. title: Once in a Blue Moon
text:
Once in a blue moon .... a perfect connection can happen.  I've been warned by a few who have gone before me that CL is an impossible place to actually meet a sane woman.  Yet, I consider myself sane and here I am.  

We all have our reasons.  I'm not looking for sex, thus I am posting on "Strictly Platonic."  But what I am hoping for is to meet a young woman who is responsible, intelligent and caring, with just enough craziness to be searching here for friendship. 

My requirements are high as should yours be.  You'll need to hold at least a bachelor's degree and be able to converse about numerous current events.  You will need to be fit as we will eventually go on long bike rides or run together.  You'll need to be available during weekday mornings and early afternoons for coffee dates.  You are probably married and not looking to change that, but you also want to find a soul mate.  You pass quite well as a typical affluent suburban woman, but you crave a more magical life.

If you desire the attention and stimulation of a fit, handsome and compassionate older gentleman ... you just may have found a match.

title: South Minneapolis Friends?
text:
I live in South Minneapolis. I have a lot of book club friends, tons of gardening friends, and too many dog walking friends. I have no one who just wants to sit down and talk. Sit down and talk about literally anything. How shitty or good your day was, what your boyfriend or girlfriend or spouse did to piss you off this morning, or even how you cried because you saw a gif of when Michael, on The Office, came back for Dwight's wedding. If you didn't cry at that, I don't know that you have a soul, though.

Anyways, I live in South Minneapolis (walking distance from a Baker's Wife and Busters and Northbound and Pilgrimage and anything worth going to in this area!) and I want people near me who want to do stuff. Not do stuff on a schedule, but do stuff when we want to. 

About me: I'm talkative, friendly, and can get along with anyone. I say that because I am insanely liberal in my beliefs. I think everyone should do what makes them happy. I think everyone should have an equal chance at having the life they deserve. If you don't believe that? That's fine. We'll just talk about sports or how adorable Chris Pratt is or how much our coworkers are failures at life. 

I like biking, making music, writing, drinking coffee, eating food, working out so I can eat food, soccer (I'm going on my fifth year as a Dark Cloud if you know what that means...hopefully you have a life and don't.), listening to music (Neutral Milk Hotel, Front Bottoms, Smith Street Band, and Desaparecidos are my favorites), and watching awful TV shows. I have to say, I'm addicted to Grimm, and I was formally addicted to Glee and Hannibal. 

Umm. I'm fairly free-spirited, love almost everyone who is trying to be an asshole, and I like to bake things for friends.

Let's hang out? I'm free this Sunday.

title: Is there anyone out of the ordinary without being crazy?
text:
I have interests different than the ones most Minnesotans are into. I don't hunt or fish. While I like sports, my life doesn't revolve around them. While I love being in nature, I'm not the outdoorsy type.

I'm also not the hipster type that's common here. I don't drink or do drugs, so breweries, sitting on patios or anywhere drinking, 420, etc, are not my thing.

I am an artist, but not the flaky kind. I'm into nerdy things like Star Wars, Legend, Monty Python, etc, but I'm not a nerd stereotype. I love a wide variety of music, mainly of the classic hard rock type such as Zeppelin and Floyd, classical, funk, alternative rock, and a lot more. 

I generally don't like most pop and rap past the early 90s, and most country though. I like classic high brow literature and comics. Pretty much any decent form of art. It doesn't have to be high brow, but it's got to be more than frat boy or gross out humor, books like 50 Shades, and movies like the Notebook. 

I'm not religious and I don't like political extremism, whether it's the right or left wing. I'd like to find someone with similar interests and views as well. I'm all for being introduced to new things that are within the range of what I generally like, but there's no way you're going to convince me that Kanye or Tyler Perry are talented when they're not, or that killing animals for fun is a good idea.

In case it's not clear: 

I'M LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH SIMILAR TASTES IN ALL THESE AREAS WHO CAN TELL ME IN THEIR RESPONSE WHAT SOME OF THEIR FAVORITES ARE THAT MATCH UP WITH THIS.

I'm getting tired of getting replies from women who either don't match up or can't tell me how they match up. I'm not a jerk, but I'm tired of this happening all the time.

I am told this is the new trend being hairy is coming back as a trend too!!

 As it is MN is so 'MN nice' with the passive aggressive type and its hard to meet people. Now this 'dad bod' is the new approach!!

 I guess I am going to quit looking for a girl to out or date and probably just have to move somewhere people are still in to fitness, healthy eating, outdoors!! Another option to find me a boyfriend.. please don't make me play the same team!! My gay friends, not being disrespectful, but, just not my type for that :) 

 Seriously! Where do I meet a girl in the Twin Cities? :)

 To the someone who is mad at this ad!! not sure why you have to be so angry!! keep moving or you should find a gym! :) Just a thought!

title: Bored, Outgoing, and looking for a friend
text: Married, Bored, Outgoing Doctor looking for a friend- Just feel like I've been stuck in a rut lately and want someone to brighten my day! I'm 35- and in great shape. Would love someone to email me during the day to bring some sunshine into it.  Put your favorite color in the title so I know you're real.
